title: U.S. Virgin Islands Is in a State of Emergency Over Lead in Water. Here’s What to Know
description: The president has declared a state of emergency over alarming data regarding lead in the territory's water supply.

title: Sean Combs Accused of Sexual Abuse by Two More Women
description: Two more women have come forward to accuse Sean 'Diddy' Combs of sexual abuse, one week after the music mogul settled a separate lawsuit.

title: What to Know About the Release of Hostages and Prisoners Amid the Gaza Ceasefire
description: Hamas reportedly released a total of 25 hostages on Friday.

title: Gaza Receives More Aid Amid the Israel-Hamas War Ceasefire. Here’s What to Know
description: Additional humanitarian aid trucks crossed from Egypt to Gaza early Friday morning, as the planned four-day ceasefire began.

title: Hamas Has Released 12 Thai Hostages. Here’s What to Know
description: The Gaza-based militant group has freed 12 Thai hostages that it’s been holding for weeks as part of a separate deal with Bangkok.

title: The Netherlands’ Ruling Party Says It Won’t Join a New Government After Far-Right’s Win
description: The party of outgoing Prime Minister Mark Rutte said it would support a center-right administration in parliament but not join the next government.

title: Taylor Swift Tickets, Paris Trips and Dining Out: Consumers Splurge Even as Savings Fall
description: YOLO consumers splurging on entertainment, travel and dining out are boosting the economy, but their savings are taking a hit.

title: South African Olympian Oscar Pistorius Will Be Released From Prison on Parole
description: Former Olympic runner Oscar Pistorius has been granted parole, 10 years after shooting his girlfriend through a door at his home in South Africa.

title: Breaking Down the Ending of Netflix’s New Swedish Thriller A Nearly Normal Family
description: Breaking down the finale of Netflix's new Swedish murder mystery series, based on M.T. Edvardsson's best-selling thriller

title: An Alliance of Taiwan’s Opposition Parties Collapsed. Here’s Why It Matters
description: The short-lived Beijing-friendly alliance could have threatened the ruling, pro-independence party in January’s election that will have far-reaching consequences for regional stability.

title: Could China’s Child Pneumonia Outbreak Spread? All You Need to Know
description: For those outside China, the reports of respiratory-illness outbreaks have brought back memories of the early days of the COVID pandemic. But unlike COVID, mycoplasma is a well-known and common germ that tends to cause fresh outbreaks every few years.

title: Philippines’ Marcos Opposes International Criminal Court Probe Into Duterte’s Drug War
description: President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. stood by his position against an international probe on former leader Rodrigo Duterte’s drug war, underlining his efforts to keep the ruling alliance intact.

title: How Netflix Is Extending Its Tentacles Across Asia in Search of the Next Squid Game
description: Now, Netflix is investing in films in markets like Thailand, Indonesia, and Taiwan, in the firm belief that the next 'Squid Game' could come from anywhere.

title: Leila de Lima Is Free but Not Finished Fighting: Exclusive Q&A With Duterte’s Leading Critic
description: The former Philippine senator was jailed for nearly seven years after speaking out against then-President Rodrigo Duterte’s drug war. Now out on bail, she’s still seeking justice.

title: Violent Clashes Break Out in Central Dublin After Knife Attack
description: Police said over 400 officers including many in riot gear, were deployed in Dublin city center to contain the unrest, which they said was “caused by a small group of thugs.”
